subject: Re: Splitting class from source
msgSnippet: You can do separate compilation for test clases into separate directory, then use junit task with classpath pointing to both test classes and classes to be
messageBody:
You can do separate compilation for test clases into separate
directory, then use junit task with classpath pointing to both test
classes and classes to be tested. It will still require to know the
location of *.java files, but it can be separate folder. Here is an
example from my build.xml, where java files are in java/test compiled
to ${test.home}/junit/classes folder.

<target name="test" depends="compile"
description="Unit Test DAO (Database Access Objects) Java sources">

<mkdir dir="${test.home}/junit/classes"/>

<javac srcdir="java/test"
destdir="${test.home}/junit/classes"
debug="yes"
deprecation="yes"
classpath="${build.home}/WEB-INF/classes"
excludes="**/CoverageTest.java">
</javac>

<junit printsummary="no"
haltonfailure="${test.haltonfailure}">
<classpath>
<pathelement location="${test.home}/junit/classes"/>
<pathelement location="${build.home}/WEB-INF/classes"/>
<pathelement
location="${catalina.home}/common/lib/classes12.jar"/>
</classpath>

<formatter type="xml"/>

<batchtest fork="no" todir="${test.home}/junit">
<fileset dir="java/test">
<include name="**/*Test.java"/>
<exclude name="**/CoverageTest.java"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>

<junitreport todir="${test.home}/junit">
<fileset dir="${test.home}/junit">
<include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="${test.home}/junit"/>
</junitreport>

<!-- Start web browser and open report for Windows 2000
covinience -->
<exec executable="cmd" os="Windows 2000">
<arg value="/c"/>
<arg file="${test.home}/junit/index.html"/>
</exec>
</target>
